thread.title: Martial's Not For Sale, Wenger Told
thread.title_full: Martial's Not For Sale, Wenger Told

title: Martial's Not For Sale, Wenger Told
text:
Martial's Not For Sale, Wenger Told 12:16, UK, Saturday 03 October 2015 Share by email Arsene Wenger has explained why he never made a move for new Manchester United signing Anthony Martial - because Monaco told him he was not for sale this summer. 
France international Martial sealed a Â£36m move from the Ligue 1 side to Old Trafford on transfer deadline day - which came as a surprise to Arsenal manager Wenger, a long-term admirer of the teenager who had been tracking him since his days at Lyon. 
The 19-year-old forward made a fine start to his Man Utd career - netting four goals in his first four games - and could play against the Gunners in the Premier League clash at the Emirates Stadium on Sunday. 
Martial could have been lining up for the north London side, rather than against them, if Wenger had had his way. 
"I was surprised they sold him," Wenger told several national newspapers. 
"The amount of money was massive. I believe that you could think that if you are Monaco you could have sold him as well next season. 
"So I thought they would not sell him this year because they sold many other players. 
"I thought they would maintain their word. He was not sellable. He was not on the list. He was one of the players Monaco did not want to sell, so we never made an approach for him. 
"Only an acceptable amount of money after could do it. We always liked him, even when he was in Lyon." Promoted Stories
